Articles.Content:
So. I spent hours on a build with the new ion/nuclear engines mod (new to me; I've been a vanilla player until this week.)

 

I built a great interstellar probe. Heavy as hell, so I figured I'd save the chassis and build a manned version. (Sub-assembly)

The first time it worked like a charm and I made interstellar orbit. But: I forgot to replace my solar panels

So: I revert, add the forgotten reflecty material, and get back to the launchpad only to find that my throttle is stuck at zero. 

I'm talking Mjolner status refuses to move. Now: if I stage through it? The upper stages...as they're exploding...show full thrust and the throttle moves. So I figured it was a glitch in the sub assembly. 

 

I recreated a sub assembly from my working probe chassis, and same result.

 

Please advise. I don't want to spend hours recreating this build only to find the same result. 

Edited December 17, 2018 by Vanamonde

I've never heard of this problem before, but I do have a question. When you say "Throttle is stuck at zero" do you mean you can throttle but it won't fire the engine or it just won't do anything at all? I'm assuming it's the latter but I just wanted to check.

On 12/15/2018 at 5:57 PM, ModernShogun said:

new ion/n﻿uclear engin﻿es mo﻿d

Which mod?  There's quite a few of them out there.   Also a full mod list will be required.

We'll also need some pics or video of it happening to help diagnose it. 

On 12/15/2018 at 5:57 PM, ModernShogun said:

So: I revert, add the forgotten reflecty material, and get back to the launchpad only to find that my throttle is stuck at zero. 

I'm talking Mjolner status refuses to move.

Like what duck said, You need to be specific in what you are describing.   When you hit shift, does the throttle indicator not move, or do the engines not react?
Thread moved to modded support, and cleaned up the language a little.

Like Gargamel said, which mods? Can we have names? Now, you call it an "Interstellar" probe, so does that mean you have more mods for other star systems? Or did you just build a huge ship that can "Escape" the sun's SOI? (Although you never really leave the sun's influence, no matter how far you go it will never say you are in interstellar space)
